# Chapter 4- Golden Ridge

The Golden Ridge will really try your patience. With its strong winds that push you around, bouncy clouds, moving blocks, and popping bubbles it will demand your accuracy. Fear not! It is possible and quite rewarding when completed. And when you collect every last secret, victory tastes so much sweeter.

Play

Below is a list of all 29 strawberries for this level, as well as the locations for the cassette tape and the Crystal Heart.

## Start

### Strawberry \#1

After learning the two new mechanics for this chapter--the clouds and the bubbles—you’ll come to a calmer area marked by the old lady and her crow. Dash into the small cove to the left of the waterfall and walk through the wall to find the strawberry.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/2/24/180129_CI_C4_S1.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

advertisement

### Strawberry \#2

On the screen after talking with the old lady, you can spot the strawberry near the bottom. Use the wind to press you against the wall with the strawberry. Climb up and dash to the column in the middle. Hop to the other side and then jump to the ledge for safety.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/e/ee/180129_CI_C4_S2.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#3

Using the bubbles to break through the walls, you can spot the strawberry near the top between columns of spikes. Use the bubble beneath to dash up and grab the fruit. The bubble will return for you to continue dashing through the walls.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/d/de/180129_CI_C4_S3.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#4

On the screen that intorduces the disappearing pink clouds you will see htis strawberry on the right side. Use the final cloud’s lift and a dash the nab it and then climb up to safety.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/7/7a/180129_CI_C4_S4.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#5

Similar to Strawberry #2, you’ll want to use the wind to collect this strawberry. Drop down to the wall adjacent to the strawberry. Use your dash to fight the rightward wind to get the strawberry. Use that wind to safely jump back to the other wall. Climb out and drop to the ground to secure the fruit.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/4/46/180129_CI_C4_S5.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#6

After activating the switches to open the path, smash the suspicious looking block in the left corner to find this strawberry.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/8/81/180129_CI_C4_S6.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#7

On the screen that has three clouds over a large hole with a leftward wind, use the second cloud to jump up and to the left. Dash to make it to the left corner where a secret path can be found.

There are four strawberry seeds on the screen. You must collect them all without your feet touching the ground to create a strawberry. Whenever you grab one seed, a leftward wind will immediately start blowing. You need to use this wind to navigate the room without touching the floor.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/2/22/180129_CI_C4_S7_A.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

Starting on the right, climb the wall to grab the first seed. Use the wind to leap to the first column and then hop over to the spring on the other side. This spring recharges your stamina and dash. Fighting the wind, jump straight up and dash to grab the wall next to the second seed. Jump off and back down to the spring to recharge with two seeds in tow.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/5/55/180129_CI_C4_S7_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

Grab onto the second column and hop over to its left side. Slide down and drop to the third seed, dashing up and to the left once you grab it. The wind will carry you to the third column. Your stamina will start to run low.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/4/4d/180129_CI_C4_S7_C.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

Hop of the third column and then to the left wall. Now wall jump up to the final seed to create the strawberry.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/d/d4/180129_CI_C4_S7_D.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

advertisement

### Cassette Tape

On the screen that has three clouds over a large hole with a leftward wind, use the second cloud to jump up and to the left. Dash to make it to the left corner where a secret path can be found. Walk to the left on the screen with the seeds.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/1/1c/180129_CI_C4_CT.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

This is the cassette room. The blue and pink platforms alternate based off the beat of the music. Time your jumps to navigate the room on the alternating platforms to grab the tape. This unlocks Chapter 4’s B Side level.

### Strawberry \#8

Use the rightward wind to wall jump up the right-hand wall without using stamina. When the wind stops jump to the column near the strawberry, using your dash. Hop over the top and grab the strawberry. The wind will kick back up and blow you back to the right side where it is safe to land.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/0/0c/180129_CI_C4_S8.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

## Shrine

This area of the chapter features one off rooms that contain plenty of secrets and strawberries. Once you complete a room, it closes off to you from further access.

### Strawberry \#9 & 10

At the start of the shrine area, head into the open path to the right. You’ll find a moving block that you’ll have to navigate through gaps to reach the strawberries on the right. That’s correct—two strawberries!

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/a/a5/180131_CI_C4_S9.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

The first is out in the open. Ride the block making sure it goes beneath the spike platforms. After jumping the second spike platform, press the block down so it can reach the far right wall. Jump and dash to grab Strawberry #9. Land on the platform again to regain your dash and grab the far right wall.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/a/a8/180131_CI_C4_S10.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

Dash through the block above to find Strawberry #10. Jump onto the left facing block and ride it back to secure both strawberries.

### Strawberry \#11

Back in the main area of the shrine, climb and dash up the left wall and enter the hallway. You can see the strawberry beneath the bridge. You’ll need to ride the moving block below to be able to grab the fruit.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/3/3c/180131_CI_C4_S11.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

Ride on the right-hand side of the block. Jump up to snag the strawberry and then dash back to the block to ride it to the other side.

### Strawberry \#12

Return to the main area of the shrine and use the moving block to go straight up. Inside this area you will find this strawberry. Use the moving blocks to cross the room and nab the fruit. Use the left facing block in the upper right corner to return back to the beginning.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/2/22/180131_CI_C4_S12.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#13

Continuing upward through the main shrine area, enter the second entrance on the left side. This strawberry requires navigating a few rooms to get to it. Using the moving block to go left, thread it through the small gap in the platforms. Hop over the obstacles and land back on your moving block, pushing it down so you may reach the other side. Jump up and dash to the platform above.

advertisement

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/2/26/180131_CI_C4_S13_A.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

In the next room you must use the upward moving block to reach bubbles at the top of the screen. Use the bubbles to make it to the top left corner and then navigate your way down the left side of the screen.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/3/32/180131_CI_C4_S13_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

On the final screen, use the bubble to move diagonally toward the moving block. Use your dash to grab on and move it to the right. When it brteaks on the ceiling, drop down and to the right to land next to the strawberry.

### Strawberry \#14

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/c/c7/180131_CI_C4_S14_A.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

Head to the area at the top of the shrine area screen. You’ll end up next to an outhouse. Use the pink cloud to hop onto the top of the moving block. Weave it up and down to reach the oppostie wall. Drop down to the next screen and walk over to get the strawberry.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/3/3b/180131_CI_C4_S14_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#15

Grab onto the moving block in the main area of the shrine and weave it to the left around the main obstacle. Go back to the right to reach the glowing area.

Hop into the water and swim to the right to find a hidden area with a strawberry. Smash the right wall to find more secrets!

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/6/6d/180131_CI_C4_S15.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#16

Grab onto the moving block in the main area of the shrine and weave it to the left around the main obstacle. Go back to the right to reach the glowing area. Hop into the water and swim to the right to find a hidden area. Smash the right wall to find a room with a Super Mario Bros. 3-esque block. Pass the block for now and smash the right wall in this room.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/4/44/180201_CI_C4_S16_A.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

The strawberry will be on the path above you. Use the moving blocks to move around the room to get the fruit. Jump onto the rightward moving block. Make sure to land on the upward block to move it out of the right block’s way.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/f/fe/180201_CI_C4_S16_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

Jump and dash up to the leftward block. Ride on this block and jump over any spikes in your way. Dash to the strawberry to collect it.

### Crystal Heart

Grab onto the moving block in the main area of the shrine and weave it to the left around the main obstacle. Go back to the right to reach the glowing area. Hop into the water and swim to the right to find a hidden area. Smash the right wall to find a room with a Super Mario Bros. 3-esque block.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/1/1d/180201_CI_C4_CH_A.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

This is more than a visual homage to the classic platformer. Just like in SMB3, hold down on the white block until you drop into the background. Using the light pink rocks that made up the background, climb up to the top area of the screen to find the Crystal Heart. Dash into it to collect it.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/1/1f/180201_CI_C4_CH_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

advertisement

### Strawberry \#17

During the final stretch of the shrine subchapter is where you will find this strawberry. You’ll use a cloud to reach a moving block. You need to weave the block through the obstacles to reach the end. On the path, you will seee the strawberry in a small area above.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/c/c0/180201_CI_C4_S17_A.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

On the small stretch of ground before the strawberry, drop down from the platform and grab onto its left side. Jump up and dash through the strawberry and land back on the block to ride it to the right side of the screen.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/0/0f/180201_CI_C4_S17_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

## Old Trail

### Strawberry \#18

Right at the start of the old trail, use the wind to wall jump up the left wall. At the top is an entry point to a room with a flying strawberry. Use the wind to land on the left wall. Climb up to the height of the strawberry and then dash into it. As you fall, hold grab so that you can grab the right wall and climb to safety.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/d/d3/180201_CI_C4_S18.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#19

You can spot this strawberry at the bottom of the screen near the beginning of the Old Trail. Fighting the wind, jump and dash up the the small "L" shaped platform up above. Now jump and dash into the bubble. Using the bubble, go to the left to land on the strawberry. Diagonally dash up to grab the column wall and climb to safety.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/c/c0/180201_CI_C4_S19.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#20

You can see this strawberry as you ride on a moving block with spikes on the left side. It’ll be at the end of the ride with a bubble leading to safety. While riding the block, you need to use the bubble to replenish your dash. Jump into the bubble and exit to the right, making sure to grab back onto the moving block.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/e/e9/180201_CI_C4_S20.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

Ride the block all the way to the right and climb up to collect the strawberry. Drop down and use the wind combined with your dash to get back to the bubble and use it to get to safety.

### Strawberry \#21

After using four moving blocks to navigate a room full of spikes, you’ll see an entry way to the left. It leads to a strawberry room that revolves around wind. A strong leftward wind will be blowing. Use it and a dash to reach the strawberry.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/7/7b/180201_CI_C4_S21_A.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

Climb up to the green crystal. Using the crystal, dash diagonally to the second green crystal to refresh your dash. Use this refresh to dash right into the small block.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/4/4f/180201_CI_C4_S21_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

Wait for the second crystal to regenerate. Once it does, jump and dash into the bubble. Exit the bubble to the right and dash immediately to make it to the small column. Make a small up to regenerate your dash. Slide down the column and dash immediately to the right to ensure you land on solid ground.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/5/5e/180201_CI_C4_S21_C.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#22

Continuing up through the room with four moving blocks to navigate through the spikes, you’ll spot this strawberry. It is in a precarious position above spikes with a switch block. Ride the moving block to the right and leap off before it gets to the wall, making sure to stop at the switch. Wait for the switch block to move all the way over. Using the switch itself as a marker, jump off and dash over the spikes to snag the fruit and grab onto the switch block. Quickly climb out and fall to safety before your stamina depletes.

advertisement

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/3/31/180201_CI_C4_S22.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#23

This strawberry is in the room with springs at the beginning. You’ll use the springs to reach bubbles and this is where you can spot your target. The strawberry is floating above spikes. You need to time your use of the bubbles to launch at the strawberry and then combining your dash with the wind safely grab onto the wall. Climb into the bubble and launch yourself back down toward the springs to go get Strawberry #24. If you only want/need this strawberry, continue up the screen.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/2/2c/180201_CI_C4_S23.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#24

This strawberry is in the room with springs at the beginning. You’ll use the springs and wind to launch into the cracked wall on the right. This hidden room is filled with bubbles that you’ll need to use to reach the top. Dash and climb your way up. You can see the strawberry beneath the final bubble. Launch down to the strawberry from the final bubble and grab onto one of the walls to wait for the bubble to return. Then use it to escape the room by going up.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/a/a9/180201_CI_C4_S24.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

## Cliff Face

### Strawberry \#25

At the start of the Cliff Face sub-chapter you can see a small crack on the ceiling. Using the cracked rock you can climb up and dash into the hole in the ceiling. Don’t worry if ypu smashed the block. You can still jump and dash your way up there, it’s just a tad trickier.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/5/5c/180201_CI_C4_S25_A.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

The trick to this strawberry room is to be on the far side of a couple of the moving blocks so that you may reach the far off platforms. Hop onto the left side of the first moving block and move it to the left. When it reaches the top, leap off and dash into the bubble. Exit the bubble to the left and immediately dash upward to avoid the spikes. Grab the wall and hop onto the next moving block.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/4/46/180201_CI_C4_S25_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

Navigate the block through the hole and then back to the right, moving it to be close to the next block. Jump over to the third block’s right side and execute the same technique as before. At the top jump into the bubble below.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/3/37/180201_CI_C4_S25_C.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

Use the bubble to grab onto the final moving block and ride it halfway up, being mindful of the spikes waiting at the very top. Drop down and dash horizontally through the gap in the spikes to snag the strawberry and land safely.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/0/07/180201_CI_C4_S25_D.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#26

This strawberry is easy to spot. It can be found floating beneath four disappearing platforms. Fight the wind by jumping and dashing to reach each platform. On the final one, jump back to nab the fruit and then dash upward to ride the wind back to a previous platform.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/c/c5/180201_CI_C4_S26.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#27

When giant snowballs start targeting you, then you’ll know you are near this strawberry. Fight the wind and dodge the snowballs as you cross the screen until you spot the fruit near the top. Make your way to the nearby bubble and launch up to float back toward the strawberry. Land on a platform to secure it.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/e/eb/180201_CI_C4_S27.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

advertisement

### Strawberry \#28

This strawberry can be found above the second bubble on the screen after the snowballs. Simply dash up from the second bubble to get the fruit and wait for the bubble to regenerate.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/0/09/180201_CI_C4_S28.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#29

This strawberry is on the final screen of the chapter. You’ll know you are there when you use a strong rightward wind to leap to bubbles. After passing the spiked column you can see the fruit beneath a bubble and spikes.

Use the closer bubble to launch toward the strawberry. Once you touch it, dash immediately upward to land in the second bubble. From here, exit straight up and ride the wind with one diagonal dash to safely grab the fall and climb to safety.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/6/66/180201_CI_C4_S29.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

# Chapter 2: Old Site

[Sign in to edit](https://auth.fandom.com/signin?redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fcelestegame.fandom.com%2Fwiki%2FChapter_2%3A_Old_Site%3Fveaction%3Dedit&uselang=en)

- [Talk (0)](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Talk:Chapter_2:_Old_Site?action=edit&redlink=1)

**Chapter 2: Old Site** is the second chapter of [Celeste](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Celeste). The chapter introduces several new [objects](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Objects), and is the first chapter to include a large amount of story content (detailed [below](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_2#Plot)). This chapter also introduces one character: [Part of Madeline](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Part_of_Madeline).

## Contents

- [1**Gameplay**](https://celestegame.fandom.com/celestegame.fandom.com#Gameplay)
 - [1.1**Objects**](https://celestegame.fandom.com/celestegame.fandom.com#Objects)
 - [1.1.1Start](https://celestegame.fandom.com/celestegame.fandom.com#Start)
 - [1.1.2Intervention](https://celestegame.fandom.com/celestegame.fandom.com#Intervention)
 - [1.1.3Awake](https://celestegame.fandom.com/celestegame.fandom.com#Awake)
 - [1.2**Crystal Heart**](https://celestegame.fandom.com/celestegame.fandom.com#Crystal_Heart)
 - [1.3**Alternate Sides**](https://celestegame.fandom.com/celestegame.fandom.com#Alternate_Sides)

 - [1.3.2Combination Lock](https://celestegame.fandom.com/celestegame.fandom.com#Combination_Lock)
 - [1.3.3Dream Altar](https://celestegame.fandom.com/celestegame.fandom.com#Dream_Altar)
 - [1.3.4Old Site C-Side](https://celestegame.fandom.com/celestegame.fandom.com#Old_Site_C-Side)
- [2**Plot**](https://celestegame.fandom.com/celestegame.fandom.com#Plot)
- [3**Quotes**](https://celestegame.fandom.com/celestegame.fandom.com#Quotes)
- [4**Speedrunning Record Progression**](https://celestegame.fandom.com/celestegame.fandom.com#Speedrunning_Record_Progression)
- [5**Major Strategies**](https://celestegame.fandom.com/celestegame.fandom.com#Major_Strategies)
- [6**Gallery**](https://celestegame.fandom.com/celestegame.fandom.com#Gallery)

## **Gameplay**\[\]

### **Objects**\[\]

#### [Start](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Start_(Old_Site))\[\]

The [B-Side Cassette Tape](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/B-Side_Cassette_Tape) for the chapter is located here.

- [Space Blocks](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Space_Blocks)
- [Spikes](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Spikes)
- [Smashable Walls](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Smashable_Walls)
- [Dash Crystals](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Dash_Crystals)
- [Falling Platforms](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Falling_Platforms)
- [Skull Binoculars](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Skull_Binoculars)
- [Cassette Blocks](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Cassette_Blocks)
- [Traffic Light Blocks](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Traffic_Light_Blocks)
- [Disappearing Platforms](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Disappearing_Platforms)

#### [Intervention](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Intervention)\[\]

- Space Blocks
- Spikes
- [Shields](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Shields)
- [Shield-Activated Platforms](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Shield-Activated_Platforms)
- [Springs](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Springs)
- Disappearing Platforms
- Falling Platforms
- Dash Crystals

#### [Awake](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Awake)\[\]

- Springs
- Spikes
- Disappearing Platforms

### **Crystal Heart**\[\]

_Main article: [Crystal Hearts Guide](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Crystal_Hearts_Guide#Chapter_2)_

The Crystal Heart is located in the first sub-chapter, Start.

### **Alternate Sides**\[\]

The B-Side is divided into three subchapters: [Start](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Start_(Old_Site_B-Side)), [Combination Lock](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Combination_Lock), and [Dream Altar](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Dream_Altar).

#### [Start](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Start_(Old_Site_B-Side))\[\]

- [Space Blocks](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Space_Blocks)
- [Spikes](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Spikes)
- [Dash Crystals](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Dash_Crystals)

#### [Combination Lock](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Combination_Lock)\[\]

- Space Blocks
- Spikes
- [Shields](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Shields)
- [Shield-Activated Platforms](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Shield-Activated_Platforms)
- Dash Crystals
- [Springs](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Springs)

#### [Dream Altar](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Dream_Altar)\[\]

- Springs
- Spikes
- Space Blocks
- Dash Crystals
- [Skull Binoculars](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Skull_Binoculars)
- Shields
- Shield-Activated Platforms
- [Cassette Blocks](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Cassette_Blocks)

#### [Old Site C-Side](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Old_Site_C-Side)\[\]

- Space Blocks
- Spikes
- Springs
- Shields
- Shield-Activated Platforms
- Skull Binoculars
- Dash Crystals

The B-Side and C-Side both place a heavy emphasis on certain space block movement maneuvers. The B-Side teaches the player about that by hitting the jump key the moment that they touch the exiting edge of a Star Block, they will be propelled faster and further out. Most of the B-Side's screens (and all of the C-Side's screens) are impossible to navigate without using this maneuver. In the C-Side, the player has to know a technique in which you can re-grab the other side of a space block by holding the climb button and holding the opposite direction it took you.

## **Plot**\[\]

**I tried to warn you.**

This section contains spoilers for Chapter 2: Old Site. Do not read the following section if you wish to avoid spoilers for Chapter 2: Old Site.

[Madeline](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Madeline) awakes to find that several mysterious changes have occurred to her surroundings: the flames of the campfire that she lit [before she went to sleep](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_1#Plot) have turned green, blue lights are descending from the sky, and the text of the [Celeste Memorial](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_1#Plot) is now re-arranging itself at random. Madeline then leaves the Celeste Memorial and starts exploring the surrounding area.

After a significant amount of exploring, Madeline encounters a large mirror. As she passes by it, she sees in it a reflection of herself with various features changed (the reflection has purple hair, white skin, and red eyes). Madeline stops after passing by the mirror and walks back over to it, where she again sees this distorted reflection. The reflection then walks over to in front of her, breaks out of the mirror, and runs away. After this occurs, several non-interactive blocks in the level transform into [Star Blocks](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Star_Blocks). Using these Star Blocks, Madeline continues to explore.

Near the Celeste Memorial, Madeline explores a previously-inaccessible area, where she finds her reflection from earlier sitting by a dead campfire. The reflection reveals herself to be not Madeline, but [Part of Madeline](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Part_of_Madeline). The two converse; Part of Madeline attempts to convince Madeline that Madeline should stop climbing Celeste Mountain, saying that it's too difficult a task for Madeline to manage. When Madeline insists that she needs to continue climbing Celeste Mountain, Part of Madeline proposes that the two of them go home together, then begins chasing Madeline through the level.

After an intense chase, Part of Madeline stops chasing Madeline and disappears, laughing. Madeline continues running until she encounters a pay-phone, which she observes to be ringing. After some hesitation, Madeline picks up the payphone, and is answered by a green-haired person, who she has an increasingly confusing conversation with. After revealing that they know that Madeline is calling from a payphone, they insist that Madeline called them. Madeline then reveals to them what has just happened to her over the course of the chapter, but they insist that she's making all of it up. As she tries to reveal more of her experiences, she realizes that she's dreaming, which they confirm, then give her more evidence to believe that she's dreaming. Part of Madeline then appears in front of Madeline, telling her that it's time for her to give up and go home, after which the payphone transforms into a giant monster and eats Madeline.

Madeline wakes up to find herself back at the Celeste Memorial, where everything has returned to normal. Madeline then encounters [Theo](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Theo), and they converse briefly. Madeline then continues until she finds the payphone again; she uses this to call her mother, who tries to help Madeline calm down.

**Show/Hide Content**

## **Quotes**\[\]

**I tried to warn you.**

This section contains spoilers for Chapter 2: Old Site. Do not read the following section if you wish to avoid spoilers for Chapter 2: Old Site.

> Part of Madeline: You can't handle this.
> Madeline: That is exactly why I need to do this.
> Madeline: Are you the weak Part of Me, or the lazy part?
> Part of Madeline: I'm the pragmatic part.

## **Major Strategies**\[\]

The A-side version of the level contains the "cutscene warp" glitch, where, by being in a particular location at the moment a specific cutscene begins, then immediately skipping it, one can clip into the ceiling, saving about one second.

The B-side version contains an esoteric skip sometimes referred to as "altarskip", where 5-6 seconds can be saved with the use of a pixel-perfect diagonal [demodash](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Demodash).

sources.text:
# Cassette Tape

From Celeste Wiki

[Jump to navigation](https://celeste.ink/celeste.ink#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://celeste.ink/celeste.ink#searchInput)

| Cassette Tape |
| --- |
| UncollectedCollected |
| Found in | [1](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City)  •  [2](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Old_Site)  •  [3](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort) [4](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Golden_Ridge)  •  [5](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Mirror_Temple)  •  [6](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Reflection) [7](https://celeste.ink/wiki/The_Summit)  •  [8](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Core) |
| [List of entities](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Entities) |

**Cassette Tapes** are special entities in the A-Sides of chapters 1 through 8. They unlock each chapter's respective [B-Side](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides#B-Sides). As such, collecting them is required to unlock a chapter's red crystal heart, and all of them must be collected before the C-Sides are unlocked. Cassette Tapes are always in a Cassette Room, featuring [Cassette Blocks](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Block) and an 8-bit remix of the chapter's music. Collecting a Cassette Tape will always lead to Madeline being transported, via bubble, back to the beginning of the room she came from (in [8A](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Core#A-Side) she gets bubbled to the end instead).

At the level select screen, you can see the checkpoint where the cassette tape (along with strawberries) is found, which can help you locate it.

## Contents

- [1Locations of Cassette Tapes](https://celeste.ink/celeste.ink#Locations_of_Cassette_Tapes)
 - [1.1Forsaken City](https://celeste.ink/celeste.ink#Forsaken_City)
 - [1.2Old Site](https://celeste.ink/celeste.ink#Old_Site)
 - [1.3Celestial Resort](https://celeste.ink/celeste.ink#Celestial_Resort)
 - [1.4Golden Ridge](https://celeste.ink/celeste.ink#Golden_Ridge)
 - [1.5Mirror Temple](https://celeste.ink/celeste.ink#Mirror_Temple)
 - [1.6Reflection](https://celeste.ink/celeste.ink#Reflection)
 - [1.7The Summit](https://celeste.ink/celeste.ink#The_Summit)
 - [1.8Core](https://celeste.ink/celeste.ink#Core)
- [2Trivia](https://celeste.ink/celeste.ink#Trivia)

## Locations of Cassette Tapes

\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?veaction=edit&section=1) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?action=edit&section=1)\]

**Thou hast been warned!**

This section contains spoilers for Celeste. Do not read the following section if you wish to avoid spoilers for Celeste.

### [Forsaken City](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City)

\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?veaction=edit&section=2) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?action=edit&section=2)\]

The cassette is hidden at the beginning of the Chasm checkpoint. To find it, go past the zipper on the left to reach an optional area, and then stand on the next zipper and launch yourself upwards. It will take you to a berry room. In the wall to the left is the hole, covered by another zip mover. Grab it to get it out of the way, and the cassette room can be found past the gap in the wall.

### [Old Site](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Old_Site)

\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?veaction=edit&section=3) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?action=edit&section=3)\]

It's found in the Start checkpoint. Go down-right to activate the dream blocks, and after coming back to the "hub" section, fall to the very bottom and dash through the dream block in the ground.

### [Celestial Resort](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort)

\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?veaction=edit&section=4) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?action=edit&section=4)\]

The cassette can be found in Elevator Shaft. Get to the key room and the entrance will be visible on the very far left. It's indicated by a light beam coming out of the hole.

### [Golden Ridge](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Golden_Ridge)

\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?veaction=edit&section=5) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?action=edit&section=5)\]

The cassette is fairly early in the Start checkpoint. After passing through the touch switch room, the next room has a hidden entrance that can be seen in the top-left corner. Use the second white cloud to reach this height, and run to the left of the berry room which takes you to another hidden area with the tape.

### [Mirror Temple](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Mirror_Temple)

\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?veaction=edit&section=6) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?action=edit&section=6)\]

This cassette is found in the Depths checkpoint and can be easily missed if you aren't exploring the entire map. After going past two rooms to the right of where you first encounter [Theo](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Theo) in the mirror, fall off the metal platform and take a red booster to the right. Then, pass the next room and the one after it to get to a room with [strawberry seeds](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Strawberry_seeds). Finally, go through a cracked wall on the right to enter the cassette room.

### [Reflection](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Reflection)

\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?veaction=edit&section=7) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?action=edit&section=7)\]

It's found in the Hollows checkpoint, behind a breakable wall on the bottom-left side. Take a Kevin block to the bottom and let it break the wall, opening the way to the cassette tape room.

### [The Summit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/The_Summit)

\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?veaction=edit&section=8) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?action=edit&section=8)\]

It can be found in the 5th room of 1500m by going through an optional path at the top. It's easily noticeable, but you must dodge a moving dust bunny that blocks the pathway.

### [Core](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Core)

\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?veaction=edit&section=9) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?action=edit&section=9)\]

The Cassette Tape room is right at the end, and you _must_ collect it to get to the Crystal Heart and complete the chapter.

## Trivia

\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?veaction=edit&section=10) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?action=edit&section=10)\]

- The original method of obtaining the Cassette Tapes was going to be by collecting several music notes. The player would have to grab multiple of them without touching the ground, similar to how [Strawberry Seeds](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Collectables#Strawberry_Seeds) work in the final game.[\[1\]](https://celeste.ink/celeste.ink#cite_note-1)
- In [Celeste 64](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celeste_64), the cassette tapes don't unlock B-Sides, but upon touching them, the player is transported to a room with a strawberry and Cassette Blocks.

1. [↑](https://celeste.ink/celeste.ink#cite_ref-1)Maddy Thorson, [Celeste Developer Commentary Livestream](https://youtu.be/u-nSjhIgmXc?si=FIAOVoy2dbKb98CJ&t=928) on YouTube

# Cassette Guide

[Edit](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Cassette_Guide?veaction=edit)

- [Edit source](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Cassette_Guide?action=edit)
- [History](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Cassette_Guide?action=history)
- [Talk (0)](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Talk:Cassette_Guide?action=edit&redlink=1)

[![Cassette BSide](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/4/4d/Cassette_BSide.png/revision/latest?cb=20200213043314)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/4/4d/Cassette_BSide.png/revision/latest?cb=20200213043314)

Cassette Tape in-game sprite

**B-Side Cassette Tapes** (or simply **Cassettes** for short) are collectible items, one of which can be found in each of the story chapters. Obtaining a chapter's Cassette is required in order to unlock the chapter's B-side level, which uses the mechanics of its respective chapter but is significantly harder. Cassettes are always obtainable in their own room after a gauntlet of [Rhythm Blocks](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Rhythm_Blocks). The following page details how to obtain these Cassettes.

## Contents

- [1Chapter 1: Forsaken City](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Cassette_Guide#Chapter_1:_Forsaken_City)
- [2Chapter 2: Old Site](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Cassette_Guide#Chapter_2:_Old_Site)
- [3Chapter 3: Celestial Resort](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Cassette_Guide#Chapter_3:_Celestial_Resort)
- [4Chapter 4: Golden Ridge](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Cassette_Guide#Chapter_4:_Golden_Ridge)
- [5Chapter 5: Mirror Temple](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Cassette_Guide#Chapter_5:_Mirror_Temple)
- [6Chapter 6: Reflection](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Cassette_Guide#Chapter_6:_Reflection)
- [7Chapter 7: The Summit](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Cassette_Guide#Chapter_7:_The_Summit)
- [8Chapter 8: Core](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Cassette_Guide#Chapter_8:_Core)

## Chapter 1: Forsaken City\[\]

This chapter's Cassette room can be found in this chapter's third sub-chapter, "Chasm". If the player goes behind the [Traffic Light Block](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Traffic_Light_Blocks) in the sub-chapter's first room, then goes two rooms up, and then goes behind the next Conveyor-belt Platform, the Cassette room will become accessible.

## Chapter 2: Old Site\[\]

This Cassette can be found in this chapter's first sub-chapter, "Start", but only after the mirror encounter with [Badeline](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Badeline). The player must go down as soon as they enter the large room (the first one where the player has any agency over movement), and must then dash down through the [Dream Block](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Dream_Blocks) in the floor of said room, exposing the Cassette room.

## Chapter 3: Celestial Resort\[\]

This Cassette can be found in this chapter's third sub-chapter, "Elevator Shaft", just to the left of the chapter's singular [Key](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Keys) (indicated by the opening through a broken wall with light shining out of it).

## Chapter 4: Golden Ridge\[\]

This chapter's Cassette can be found in this chapter's first sub-chapter, "Start". Just after finishing the room that requires the player to collect two [Shields](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Shields) in order to move a [Shield-Activated Platform](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Shield-Activated_Platforms), the player must bounce on the second [White Cloud](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/White_Clouds) from the left, then dash up and left in order to access the top-left corner of the room. The player must then go as far left as possible, passing through the following room (which should contain a number of [Springs](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Springs) and strawberry fragments in order to find this Cassette's room.

## Chapter 5: Mirror Temple\[\]

This Cassette can be found in this chapter's second sub-chapter, "Depths". After passing the third [Temple Gate](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Temple_Gates)—the one just after a challenge involving a single [Swap Block](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Swap_Blocks)—the player should head down and to the right in order to find a hidden room leading to a [Red Orb](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Red_Orbs). Taking this orb to the right will lead to a platforming segment; completing this segment and pressing the [Dash Switch](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Dash_Switches) there will open another Temple Gate to the bottom right of this room. Clearing this second room by depressing its Dash Switch will open yet another Temple Gate at the bottom right of this following room, leading to a third, more illuminated room. At the bottom right of this third room, the player can simply walk through a section of cracked wall (with or without completing any associated challenges) to access the Cassette room.

## Chapter 6: Reflection\[\]

This Cassette can be found in the first room of this chapter's third sub-chapter, "Hollows". To access the Cassette room, the player must use the nearby [Kevin Block](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Kevin_Blocks) to break the wall below it and send the Block to the bottom of the lake. The player must then quickly attack the Kevin Block again to make it break the wall to its left, exposing the entryway into the Cassette room.

## Chapter 7: The Summit\[\]

This chapter's Cassette can be found in its fourth sub-chapter, "1500M". Upon entering this sub-chapter's fifth room, an opening can be seen leading out the top of the room. Entering this opening will lead to the cassette room.

## Chapter 8: Core\[\]

This cassette lies at the end of the chapter and is required to complete it.

# Cassette Tapes

## Cassette Tapes

Play

One cassette tape can be found per chapter. These are in one-off rooms that have blue and pink platforms that alternate based off a beat. Using these musical platforms, you try to make it to the tape at the end of the room.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/c/cb/180124_CI_C1_Cassette_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

These unlock B-Sides of the chapters, which are harder versions of the originals. They feature remixed versions of the songs. There are no strawberries in the B-Side levels and each level ends with a Red Crystal Heart.

# Alternate sides

From Celeste Wiki

[Jump to navigation](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides#searchInput)

**Alternate sides** (namely **B-Sides** and **C-Sides**) are essentially harder but shorter versions of a chapter. They exist in every chapter except [Prologue](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Prologue), [Epilogue](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Epilogue) and [Farewell](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Farewell).

In alternate sides, a remix of the chapter's music is used. These remixes are known as [Celeste B-Sides](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celeste_B-Sides), although the exact same soundtrack plays in C-Sides as well.

Alternate sides do not have any [Red Strawberries](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Collectables#Red_Strawberries), but [Golden Strawberries](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Golden_Strawberries) can be found and collected there if they have been unlocked and the alternate side has been completed before.

Additionally, alternate sides of all levels will be instantly unlocked when [Cheat Mode](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cheat_Mode) is enabled in the save file.

## Contents

- [1B-Sides](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides#B-Sides)
- [2C-Sides](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides#C-Sides)
- [3Trivia](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides#Trivia)
- [4References](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides#References)

## B-Sides\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides?veaction=edit&section=1) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides?action=edit&section=1)\]

[![](https://static.wikitide.net/celestewiki/4/4a/Red_crystal_heart_asset.png)](https://celeste.ink/wiki/File:Red_crystal_heart_asset.png) A Red Crystal Heart

A B-Side for a given chapter can be unlocked by collecting a [Cassette Tape](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape) in the A-Side of the level. It can then be accessed right away, even if the A-Side is not completed yet, and it is possible to unlock the new chapter by completing the B-Side instead. This is commonly used in speedruns to save time, since 5B and 6B are shorter than their A-Side counterparts.

Like A-Sides, B-Sides are segmented into checkpoints.

At the end of each B-Side is a Cassette Block Room, the only room in the B-Side having [Cassette Blocks](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Blocks), and which ends with a Red [Crystal Heart](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Crystal_Heart). Collecting the Red Crystal Heart by dashing into it ends the B-Side.

Completing all B-Sides except [Core B-Side](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Core#B-Side) is required to unlock the [Crystal Heart Gate](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Crystal_Heart_Gate) in [Farewell](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Farewell) and 8B.

[1B](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City#B-Side)  •  [2B](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Old_Site#B-Side)  •  [3B](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort#B-Side)

[4B](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Golden_Ridge#B-Side)  •  [5B](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Mirror_Temple#B-Side)  •  [6B](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Reflection#B-Side)

[7B](https://celeste.ink/wiki/The_Summit#B-Side)  •  [8B](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Core#B-Side)

## C-Sides\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides?veaction=edit&section=2) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides?action=edit&section=2)\]

[![](https://static.wikitide.net/celestewiki/5/54/Yellow_crystal_heart_asset.png)](https://celeste.ink/wiki/File:Yellow_crystal_heart_asset.png) A Yellow Crystal Heart

C-Sides are unlocked after completing 8B, which, in turn, requires completion of all B-Sides. They are significantly shorter than A-Sides and B-Sides, consisting of 3–4 rooms with no checkpoints. However, the rooms are longer and more difficult, with the final room being significantly longer than most usual rooms.

C-Sides end with a Yellow Crystal Heart. Like its B-Side, completing all other C-sides is required to unlock the Crystal Heart Gate in [Core C-Side](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Core#C-Side), which on completion unlocks [Variant Mode](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Variant_Mode) and [Golden Strawberries](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Golden_Strawberries).

[1C](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City#C-Side)  •  [2C](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Old_Site#C-Side)  •  [3C](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort#C-Side)

[4C](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Golden_Ridge#C-Side)  •  [5C](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Mirror_Temple#C-Side)  •  [6C](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Reflection#C-Side)

[7C](https://celeste.ink/wiki/The_Summit#C-Side)  •  [8C](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Core#C-Side)

## Trivia\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides?veaction=edit&section=3) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides?action=edit&section=3)\]

- B-Sides were initially called "Hard Mode" during development and later named "Remix Mode" before ultimately being named "B-Sides" [\[1\]](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides#cite_note-1)
- Progressing through completing B-Sides before A-Sides was unintended.[\[2\]](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides#cite_note-2)

## References\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides?veaction=edit&section=4) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides?action=edit&section=4)\]

1. [↑](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides#cite_ref-1)Maddy Thorson, [Celeste Developer Commentary Livestream](https://youtu.be/u-nSjhIgmXc?si=uCBKshtHCVu7axpY&t=1149) on YouTube
2. [↑](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides#cite_ref-2)[Kevin Regamey](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Kevin_Regamey) on [Celestecord (link to message)](https://discord.com/channels/403698615446536203/407055931138899969/701844244759052310) April 20, 2020

# Crystal Heart Guide

[Edit](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Crystal_Heart_Guide?veaction=edit)

- [Edit source](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Crystal_Heart_Guide?action=edit)
- [History](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Crystal_Heart_Guide?action=history)
- [Talk (0)](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Talk:Crystal_Heart_Guide?action=edit&redlink=1)

[![Crystal Heart](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/4/42/Crystal_Heart.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/100?cb=20180717094116)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/4/42/Crystal_Heart.png/revision/latest?cb=20180717094116)

A blue Crystal Heart.

Blue **Crystal Hearts** are collectibles throughout the game and are one of the three types of hearts which are used to unlock various gates throughout the game such as [Chapter 8](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_8) and its alternate sides as well as [Chapter 9](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_9) past the heart gate in [Event Horizon](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Event_Horizon) (see [this page](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Collectibles#Crystal_Hearts) for more information on the different types of hearts). The following page details how to obtain the blue Crystal Hearts in the game.

## Contents

- [1Chapter 1](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Crystal_Heart_Guide#Chapter_1)
- [2Chapter 2](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Crystal_Heart_Guide#Chapter_2)
- [3Chapter 3](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Crystal_Heart_Guide#Chapter_3)
- [4Chapter 4](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Crystal_Heart_Guide#Chapter_4)
- [5Chapter 5](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Crystal_Heart_Guide#Chapter_5)
- [6Chapter 6](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Crystal_Heart_Guide#Chapter_6)
- [7Chapter 7](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Crystal_Heart_Guide#Chapter_7)
 - [7.1Star](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Crystal_Heart_Guide#Star)
 - [7.2Sapphire](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Crystal_Heart_Guide#Sapphire)
 - [7.3Emerald](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Crystal_Heart_Guide#Emerald)
 - [7.4Gold](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Crystal_Heart_Guide#Gold)
 - [7.5Diamond](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Crystal_Heart_Guide#Diamond)
 - [7.6Pearl](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Crystal_Heart_Guide#Pearl)
 - [7.7Crystal Heart](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Crystal_Heart_Guide#Crystal_Heart)
- [8Chapter 8](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Crystal_Heart_Guide#Chapter_8)
- [9Trivia](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Crystal_Heart_Guide#Trivia)

## Chapter 1\[\]

[![Pointless Machine Achievement](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/5/55/Pointless_Machine_Achievement.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180820205431)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/5/55/Pointless_Machine_Achievement.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180820205431)

Pointless machines

The Crystal Heart in this chapter can be found in [Chapter 1](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_1)'s second sub-chapter, [Crossing](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Crossing). After passing the house, the player must get on the first [Conveyor-Belt Platform](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Conveyor-Belt_Platforms) in the following room and advance to the second as usual; however, on the second Conveyor-Belt Platform, the player must jump left as they're flung into the air and dash upwards to the left of the up sign, revealing a secret passage. The player must then dash to the left from there to get to the room connecting to this screen's top-left corner. After a few screens, the player will arrive at the location of a computer. Here the Crystal Heart puzzle begins.

The computer will flash a sequence of colors; nearby, there will be a number of small, colored birds, each of whom corresponds with a color that the computer flashes. The computer will flash a series of colors intermittently, followed by the birds all moving in different directions. To obtain the heart, one must pay attention to the sequence of colors that the computer flashes, as well as the directions that the birds move in every time the sequence finishes. The player must dash in the direction that each bird corresponds to in the order in the computer's light sequence where that bird's color appears on the computer (in relation to the other colors, not in real time). The direction sequence that the player must perform is:

[![Celeste Birds](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/e/e7/Celeste_Birds.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/220?cb=20201006071705)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/e/e7/Celeste_Birds.png/revision/latest?cb=20201006071705)

Color Directions

- Up (White)
- Left (Purple)
- Down-Right (Blue)
- Up-Right (Red)
- Left (Purple)
- Up-Left (Yellow)

Performing this series of dashes will cause the birds to form into this chapter's Crystal Heart (entitled _Pointless machines_) which the player can then obtain.

## Chapter 2\[\]

[![Resurrections](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/5/5e/Resurrections.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190213173921)

Resurrections

The Crystal Heart in this chapter is located in [Chapter 2](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_2)'s first sub-chapter, [Start](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Start_(Old_Site)). In theory, this Crystal Heart should be quite easy to locate, being two screens up from the starting screen of the chapter. In practice, it is very difficult to locate, as there are no [objects](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Objects) that will help one to get there. One of the ways to get there is by exploiting a piece of the game's physics that recharges the player's dash when the player moves from one screen to another. This mechanic is not directly taught in the game (although it is indirectly taught when the player attempts to collect an early strawberry in [Chapter 3](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_3:_Celestial_Resort)), and for this reason, it is regarded by many as one of the hardest Crystal Hearts to find without a guide. The mechanic allows the player to essentially climb thin air by dashing off of the right side of the first screen onto the second screen, then back, repeating until the player moves up to the screen above the first screen. After climbing up a wall from this third screen onto a fourth screen, the player can then fall down onto the third screen, dash onto the fourth screen, and repeat until one finds a wall. The player can then climb this wall, after which the player can easily reach the topmost screen, where one can simply walk over to this chapter's Crystal Heart (entitled _Resurrections_) and obtain it.

Another way to get to this crystal heart is to first get onto the second screen, climb up the wall, stand on the left edge of the platform above the second screen, jump to the far left of the platform and then dash left as soon as the player leaves the screen. By doing so, the player lands on the platform on the left and can then continue climbing up towards the crystal heart.

The heart can also be seen (but not obtained) in the [Awake](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Awake) subchapter of Chapter 2, where it is easier to locate, and a poem lies near it with hints of how to obtain it:

_An apparition_

_Not of this world_

_But because of it_

_Lurking_ _**out of frame**_

_Awake, my heart is a fortress_

_**In dreams I am vulnerable**_

## Chapter 3\[\]

[![Scattered and lost](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/7/7f/Scattered_and_lost.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190213174144)

Scattered and lost

The Crystal Heart in [Chapter 3](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_3) is located in the second sub-chapter, [Huge Mess](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Huge_Mess). After being tasked to help clean up by Mr. Oshiro, the player must advance to the lower path of the two in the upper right corner. Once the player reaches and activates the large button to clear the purple and white towels, one must advance not to the left as usual, but to the right. The player must then travel up into the crevice that a stream of water is falling out of to reveal a secret path, leading back to one of the earlier rooms of the path. One must then advance upwards and then to the left (in reverse of the way the player first goes through the area) until the player reaches the first room, where the player first runs into Theo in Chapter 3. There is a path at the top of the screen that was previously blocked by towels; the player must dash up to this path and follow it upward to find this chapter's Crystal Heart (entitled _Scattered and lost_) and obtain it.

## Chapter 4\[\]

[![Eye of the storm](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/e/e4/Eye_of_the_storm.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190213174319)

Eye of the storm

[Chapter 4](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_4)'s Crystal Heart is located at the very beginning of the second sub-chapter, [Shrine](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Shrine). To reach the Crystal Heart, the player must cling to the [Guided Platform](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Guided_Platforms), then navigate it left to avoid hitting the wall, after which the player should move it back to the right. Once the player lands, the player must go to the right, into the lit up area. Once one goes into the next room, the player should see a waterfall pouring into a pool of [water](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Water). The player must then swim towards the bottom right corner, and keep swimming to the right until the player reaches a hidden area with a strawberry. The player must then dash into the [Smashable Wall](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Smashable_Walls) to the right to break it, after which the player should reach a tall room. One cannot reach the top normally; the player must crouch on top of the room's idiosyncratic white block until the player disappears. The player is now in the background instead of the foreground, thus allowing one to interact with objects in the background (a trick borrowed from [Super Mario Bros. 3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Super_Mario_Bros._3), which has a similar block with a similar gimmick). This object interaction allows the player to climb to the top of the screen, where the Crystal Heart (entitled _Eye of the storm_) is located.

## Chapter 5\[\]

[![Quiet and falling](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/e/e2/Quiet_and_falling.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190213175216)

Quiet and falling

[Chapter 5](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_5)'s Crystal Heart is located in the second sub-chapter, [Depths](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Depths). After getting the key above the statue, the player must enter the room beneath the statue to the right, then hop on the nearby bubble and travel to the right. Instead of opening the door at the end of the room, the player must enter a second bubble and travel to the left, then dash up into the center of the second platform on their way back. This moves the player into a third bubble that they can use to travel upwards, leading to a secret path above the door. After making their way through the long hallway to reach the next room and going through that room as normal, the player must now head to the bottom of the following room and dash downwards to break the brown [Smashable Wall](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Smashable_Walls) in the floor. This reveals another locked door that they can use the key on, which leads to the Crystal Heart's room. In order to navigate in the room, one must go along the outer edges of the room, using a set of moving blocks and platforms to get to the Crystal Heart (entitled _Quiet and falling_) and obtain it.

## Chapter 6\[\]

[![Heavy and frail](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/4/4d/Heavy_and_frail.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190213175253)

Heavy and frail

[Chapter 6](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_6:_Reflection)'s Crystal Heart is located at the beginning of the third sub-chapter, [Hollows](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Hollows). At the start of the sub-chapter, the player must use the [Angry Platform](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Angry_Platforms) to break through the wall below to get to the first [Feather](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Feathers). One must then use it to fly up-right, and then dash down to break the [Smashable Wall](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Smashable_Walls), revealing the second Feather. The player must use that Feather to fly upwards, then climb to the third Feather, and finally use that Feather to fly to the left of the screen, revealing an entrance to a secret room. After going through the room and breaking another Smashable Wall, the player will see a puzzle with a statue, 6 colored crystals, 4 torches and 3 symbols.

[![Celeste Birds](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/e/e7/Celeste_Birds.png/revision/latest?cb=20201006071705)

Bird Color Directions (see Chapter 1)

In order to solve the puzzle, one must repeat the pattern required to obtain the first chapter's Crystal Heart; doing so correctly will light up the first torch. The same thing must be done for the rest, but with slight alterations for each following torch: the second torch's pattern must be the first, but mirrored left-right (e.g an up-left on the first torch must be an up-right dash for the second); the third torch's pattern has to be mirrored up-down (e.g. an upwards dash on the first must be a downwards dash for the third), and the fourth one's pattern must be mirrored both up-down and left-right (e.g. an up-left dash on the first must be a down-right dash for the fourth). For a complete list of directions, see below:

- First torch: Up, Left, Down-Right, Up-Right, Left, Up-Left
- Second torch: Up, Right, Down-Left, Up-Left, Right, Up-Right
- Third torch: Down, Left, Up-Right, Down-Right, Left, Down-Left
- Fourth torch: Down, Right, Up-Left, Down-Left, Right, Down-Right

After lighting up all 4 torches, the Crystal Heart (entitled _Heavy and frail_) will be granted on top of the statue.

## Chapter 7\[\]

[![Pink sunrise](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/c/c3/Pink_sunrise.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190213175701)

Pink sunrise

To obtain the crystal heart in [Chapter 7](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_7), you must find six Jewels hidden in each subchapter— a blue star for Reflection at the [Start](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Start_(The_Summit)), a sapphire square for Forsaken City at [500 M](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/500_M), an emerald oval for Old Site at [1000 M](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/1000_M), a gold circle for Celestial Resort at [1500 M](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/1500_M), a pink diamond for Golden Ridge at [2000 M](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/2000_M), and a white pearl for Mirror Temple at [2500 M](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/2500_M). You obtain the crystal heart in [3000 M](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/3000_M) after getting all the Jewels.

#### Star\[\]

The first Jewel is located at the end of the last screen of the Start subchapter. After bouncing off of the last [Spring](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Springs), the player must use both dashes to jump over the final [Purple Orb](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Purple_Orbs), then climb up the wall on the right. The screen should move, revealing the first Jewel.

#### Sapphire\[\]

The route to 500 M's Jewel starts in the sub-chapter's 3rd screen, where, after going up on the first [Traffic Light Block](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Traffic_Light_Blocks), the player must go left instead of going right at the intersection. The player should then go right after climbing to the top of the tall screen that follows. In the following room, just to the right of the second Traffic Light Block, there is a tiny gap in the ground, which the player must fall through to find the room with the second Jewel. Completing the spike-lined obstacle course will allow the player to obtain this Jewel.

#### Emerald\[\]

For 1000 M's Jewel, the player must go through the upper left or upper right route of the 5th screen of the subchapter. If you choose the upper left route, you have to go up through the first [Space Block](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Space_Blocks), then use the Space Block on the right to break a [Smashable Wall](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Smashable_Walls). You will then enter into a room with a strawberry. Going up through the spiked platform will lead you to the path to the Jewel. Going the upper right route will skip the berry. The player must dash to the right in the middle of two Space Blocks to break a Smashable Wall; breaking this wall will reveal another room with [Skull Binoculars](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Skull_Binoculars), as well as with a concealed [Disappearing Platform](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Disappearing_Platforms) which the player must stand on to fall to the chamber below. Completing this chamber will allow the player to obtain this Jewel.

#### Gold\[\]

1500 M's Jewel is at the end of the 7th screen of the subchapter and is probably the easiest one to find. Below the exit upwards into the 8th screen, a broken wall can be seen. Going through there and completing the room that it reveals will allow the player to obtain this Jewel.

#### Diamond\[\]

2000 M's Jewel is a trek to get to. To the left of the second room is a seemingly pointless room. In one of the gaps above the player (the widest one above the pit of [Crystal Spikes](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Crystal_Spikes)), there is a secret platform to stand on, which the player can use to jump all the way to the left of the screen. In the next screen, there is a broken area of the roof, providing another entrance to a secret platform. The player must get there, jump off to the left, dash up to the left, and then dash up as soon as the player is past the wall that they need to climb up. Going up through the hole will reveal the Jewel.

#### Pearl\[\]

To reach 2500 M's Jewel, the player must take the first Red Bubble left, causing it to break the wall at the left of the first screen. The player must then enter the Red Bubble in the newly revealed screen and take that to the right, causing it to break several more walls before it eventually stops moving. The player must then go up and complete the following screen to obtain this Jewel.

#### Crystal Heart\[\]

At checkpoint 28 at 3000 M, the player must dash under the gap in the wall to the player's right, causing the camera to move and reveal the room with the Crystal Heart. If the player has all of the Jewels, they will pop out of the floor, and the Crystal Heart (entitled _Pink sunrise_) will move to a place where the player can obtain it.

## Chapter 8\[\]

[![Heart of the Mountain](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/1/19/Heart_of_the_Mountain.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190213175751)

Heart of the mountain

The Crystal Heart in [Chapter 8](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_8) is the most straightforward to obtain, as it is required to obtain at the end of the fourth subchapter, [Heart of the Mountain](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Heart_of_the_Mountain), to complete the chapter. After getting past all of the chapter's obstacles, the player can complete the level and simultaneously be awarded the Crystal Heart (entitled _Heart of the mountain_).

## Trivia\[\]

- The Jewels in [Chapter 7](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_7) appear to be based on the Jewels in the character select screen in TowerFall, matching in both shape and color.

Community content is available under [CC-BY-SA](https://www.fandom.com/licensing) unless otherwise noted.

- [1Crystal Heart Guide](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Crystal_Heart_Guide)
- [2Chapter 9: Farewell](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_9:_Farewell)

### 5

Assez mitigé, j’ai trouvé le concept intéressant avec le mode marchand et les différents donjons à explorer. Cependant très vite on se retrouve à devoir faire que farmer pour pouvoir fabriquer de nouveaux équipements et améliorer sa boutique.
Alors oui c’est le principe, sauf que c’est tellement compliqué au début que ça en devient vraiment frustrant et ennuyant, une fois qu’on a compris comment ça fonctionne, tout est super répétitif pourtant j’aime beaucoup les rogue-like… j’ai continué uniquement parce que le premier boss était bien fait et je voulais voir les suivants.
Une fois arrivé au donjon 3 ça s’enchaîne beaucoup plus vite, on se fait de l’argent rapidement, donc un meilleur équipement et ça devient plus amusant.
L’ambiance reste néanmoins poétique, la DA pixel art fonctionne bien et on prend goût à vendre ses trouvailles.
Ça ferait un bon jeu mobile mais sur console ça reste très moyen, pour moins de 10€ le jeu vaut le coup.

Nov 5, 2023
